definitions.definition: a tube of metal, plastic, or other material used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances.
examples: tube, conduit, hose, main, duct, line, channel, pipeline, drain; Moretubing, piping, siphon "a water pipe"Moretubing, piping, siphon a water pipe

definitions.definition: a cylindrical vein of ore or rock, especially one in which diamonds are found.
a cavity in cast metal.
a duct, vessel, or tubular structure in the body, or in an animal or plant.
a connection to the Internet or to a website.
a narrow tube made from wood, clay, etc., with a bowl at one end for containing burning tobacco, the smoke from which is drawn into the mouth.
examples: brier (pipe), meerschaum, chibouk; Morehookah, narghile, bong, churchwarden "he smokes a pipe"Morehookah, narghile, bong, churchwarden he smokes a pipe

definitions.definition: a quantity of tobacco held by this.
a device for smoking illegal drugs.
a wind instrument consisting of a single tube with holes along its length that are covered by the fingers to produce different notes.
synonyms: fife; chanter "she was playing a pipe"

definitions.definition: bagpipes.
examples: bagpipes, uillean pipes; pan pipes regimental pipes and drums

definitions.definition: a set of pipes joined together, as in panpipes.
a tube by which sound is produced in an organ.
voice or vocal ability, especially of a powerful singer.
a high-pitched cry or song, especially of a bird.
a boatswain's whistle.
a command that causes the output from one routine to be the input for another.
the symbol |.
a cask for wine, especially as a measure equal to two hogsheads, usually equivalent to 105 gallons (about 477 liters).
convey (water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances) through a pipe or pipes.
examples: water from the lakes is piped to several towns
synonyms: convey "the beer is piped into barrels"

definitions.definition: transmit (music, a radio or television program, signals, etc.) by wire or cable.
examples: transmit, feed, patch television shows piped in from New York

definitions.definition: play (a tune) on a pipe or pipes.
examples: play on a pipe, tootle, whistle; flute he heard a tune being piped

definitions.definition: (of a bird) sing in a high or shrill voice.
examples: chirp, cheep, chirrup, twitter, warble, trill, peep, sing, shrill a curlew piped

definitions.definition: say something in a high, shrill voice.
use a boatswain's whistle to summon (the crew) to work or a meal.
examples: the hands were piped to breakfast

definitions.definition: decorate (clothing or soft furnishings) with a thin cord covered in fabric.
put (a decorative line or pattern) on a cake or similar dish using icing, whipped cream, etc.
